page.title: 19SW BASINGSTOKE: LEISURE
page.content: In the villages of {Cliddesden} and { {Farleigh Wallop} there are not any playgrounds because most of the houses have large gardens. On the Brighton Hill estate there are many playgrounds as the houses have small gardens. On Cliddesden Hill, next to the M3, is an adventure playground which has a bouncy bridge, two huge slides, swings, climbing frames and a wooden fort which is on the top of the hill. It is exciting to play there. Football, cricket and rugby are played on the Common with walking and jogging also popular as the countryside is only five minutes walk away. Other people pass their time in one of the several allotment sites in the area. Less energetic are visits to one of the three pubs or going to meetings at the community centres.
